intro: Lepidium quitense var. microphyllum, commonly known as Peruvian pepper or *ají panca*, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, pinnately compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in racemes. The plant is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. Its seeds are used as a spice and have a peppery, slightly sweet flavor. The botanical features of this variety include its compact growth habit and adaptation to high-altitude environments.
